result.execSummary:
The defendant Jacob P. Bergum was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Refrain from conduct which constitutes a violation of the criminal laws of any state of the United States or ordinances substantially conforming to a criminal statute.
Bond continued.
Continue to participate in treatment and comply with provider recommendations.
Provide proof of treatment compliance to DA's office every four months.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: 8:40 a.m. Defendant Jacob P. Bergum in court with attorney Mary L. Roth Burns.  Jillian Pfeifer appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Burns states defendant does not contest violation of agreeement - Burns moves that domestic abuse enhancer be removed - State has no objections - Court finds grounds to reinstitute proceedings. Court grants motion to dismiss enhancer. Pfiefer/Burns/Court statement on sentencing. Court imposes forfeiture in amount $150 plus costs. Defendant states he can pay $150 today. Appeal rights given. Payment plan application given. Adj. 8:46 a.m.  Review hearing scheduled for September 26, 2016 at 03:00 pm.
Motion hearing on June 15, 2016 at 08:30 am.

3:56 p.m. Defendant Jacob P. Bergum in court with attorney Mary Burns for Mary Margaret Hogan.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Schiek statement to new charges in Green County. State moves to rescind - will file necessary paperwork. Attorney Burns provides new address for defendant of 548 Delaney Street, Highland, WI. Adj. 3:58 p.m.

03:20 pm - Defendant Jacob P. Bergum in court with attorney Mary Margaret Hogan.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant pleads no contest.  DPA filed.    Court reads on waiver of rights and tendering plea. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that a factual basis for the plea exists but defers judgment and accepts the DPA.  Bail continued.  Review hearing scheduled for May 9, 2016 at 03:30 pm.
States Reply to Discovery  and State's Demand for Discovery
Take all meds as prescribed and only in the dosage prescribed.  No contact with Alicia Jones is lifted.
No contact with Alicia Jones lifted

In receipt of complaint, waive reading - not guilty plea.  Hogan/Schiek statement to motion to modify bond - no contact provision.  Court denies motion.  Bail continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 19, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
